Job Title: Major of Professional Standards and Training Manager

Location: Indianapolis, IN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Management, Other

Description:
Overview

Build your career with IU Health!  We have an exciting opportunity available for a Major of Professional Standards and Training Manager to join the Public Safety team at our Indianapolis, IN location.

The Major of Professional Standards and Training Manager provides progressive leadership to the Professional Standards Section of the IU Health Department of Public Safety. Management of the day-to-day functions such as operational investigation, information sharing, training and policy needs of the department as they relate to the IU Health Mission and Values. Responsible for management of agency investigative, evidence, and chains of custody issues in alignment with the Department of Public Safety's Statement of Support to the IU Health Mission and Values. Ensures policy alignment to include the safety and security of employees, patients, visitors and their property, as well as corporate assets at their assigned campus. Coordinates compliance with the National Incident Based Reporting System (NIBRS) and information sharing between key internal and external partners. Directs development and execution of a department-wide training program. Engages with internal and external services and resources, including local, county, state, university and federal public safety agencies, behavioral health services and healthcare providers.

At IU Health, your personal and professional growth is a top priority. You will have access to many diverse opportunities to learn and develop in meaningful ways that matter most to you, such as training, leadership development, promotion opportunities and cross training development.  We offer a comprehensive benefits package designed for you, which includes Medical-Dental-Vision, a matching 401K, PTO, tuition reimbursement program, wellness program, and more! 

Associate's Degree is required. Bachelor's Degree is preferred.Requires 5-7 years of relevant experience.Completion of FBI National Academy or similar Command College is preferred.Requires experience with planning, developing and executing law enforcement and public safety training.Requires experience with criminal and internal affairs investigations and evidence/property management.Requires familiarity with information sharing and public safety training.Requires familiarity with developing and maintaining policies and procedures to meet standards of law enforcement and security accreditation.Requires familiarity with NIMS and HICS/ICS.Requires knowledge of city, state and federal laws, regulations and ordinances.Requires working knowledge of computers and various software programs.Requires successful completion of the Firearms Proficiency Test with continuous requalification on a semi-annual basis.Must undergo a psychological evaluation. Requires ability to successfully complete all requirements for a Hospital Police Officer as set by I.C. 16-18-4-4.Requires current and non-restricted Driver's License.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at IU Health. IU Health does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, national origin, gender identity and/or expression, marital status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Experience Level (if available): Director
